Body:
I am using the DOIT ESP32 DEVKIT V1 (www.doit.com) development board.

LuaNode is loaded. When the device is reset
column9:
version 1.3.0 is reported

=======================================	LuaNode: https://github.com/Nicholas3388/LuaNode	Version: 1.3.0	=======================================

lib tmr is also loaded.

Trying to use a simple timer fails:

> t = tmr.create()	stdin:1: attempt to call field 'create' (a nil value)
"

Body: @ephemerr https://nodemcu.readthedocs.io/en/master/en/modules/tmr/ The log states it is loaded, found no error messages
There is timer example on LuaNode project's site. Does it work? If not try to rise issue there  https://github.com/Nicholas3388/LuaNode/blob/master/LuaNode_Esp32/LuaNode32/lua_samples/timer/timer.lua
What is lib `tmr` and how it was loaded? Looks like it haven't been  loaded properly.
@ephemerr Yes, the basic examples work. But scheduling (register) and the method described in this post do not work
